intro: Aneilema chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua aneilema, is a flowering plant native to the Chihuahua region of Mexico. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as philodendrons and peace lilies. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, spadix-like inflorescences, typical of the arum family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native habitat.
